intro: Perymenium serratum, commonly known as the serrated perymenium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbellate clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
